application

Class ReadWriteFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.ReadWriteFile

  • public class ReadWriteFile
extends java.lang.Object
    This class reads and writes data into files Example methods include: Reading a string or object from a file Writing the frequency of words, or serializing an object to a file Clearing all of a file's data
    Author:
    Jacob Meksavanh

        Reads a file's plain text

        Throws:

      • readFileAndReturn

        public static java.lang.String readFileAndReturn(java.lang.String file,
                                                 java.lang.String lang)
        Reads a file's plain text using a given language
        Parameters:
        file - the file's path as a String
        lang - the language which permits the BufferedReader to read non-English characters
        Returns:
        a string representation of a file's data
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - for Input/Output errors

      • writeFrequencyUsingArrayList

        public static void writeFrequencyUsingArrayList(java.lang.String file,
                                                java.util.ArrayList<Word> allWords,
                                                int minFreq)
        Writes the plain text representation of a word alongside its frequency to a file. Frequency of a word must be greater than the given minimum for it to be printed.
        Parameters:
        file - the file's path as a String
        allWords - ArrayList that holds Word objects to be written as plain text
        minFreq - minimum required frequency of a word needed so that it may be printed
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - for Input/Output errors

      • writeFrequencyListPercentage

        public static void writeFrequencyListPercentage(java.lang.String file,
                                                java.util.ArrayList<Word> allWords)
        Writes the plain text representation of a word alongside its frequency to a file. Frequency of a word must be greater than a percentage of all words (usually 1%) for it to be printed.
        Parameters:
        file - the file's path as a String
        allWords - ArrayList that holds Word objects to be written as plain text alongside their frequency in the given file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - for Input/Output errors
